intro: Oreobroma mexicanum, commonly known as the Mexican mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open areas, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom in the morning, hence its common name. Oreobroma mexicanum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
